basics.name: Nicholas Russo
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software developer with 2.5 years of experience specializing in backend development and scalable API architecture using Python, Rust, and Go. Demonstrated expertise in optimizing system performance and reliability through efficient, maintainable code. Currently building AI/ML infrastructure with focus on vector databases and LLM engineering.

work.name: Omnitier, Inc.
highlights: Developed regression testing system using Go and Python, significantly improving code stability
Optimized Python script performance by ~90%, reducing runtime from 45 minutes to 5 minutes by minimizing system calls
Enhanced React frontend with new features using gRPC API and resolved critical bugs

skills.name: Infrastructure
keywords: Linux (Gentoo, CoreOS, Alpine, Fedora, RHEL, Ubuntu)

projects.name: OmenDB
projects.description: PostgreSQL-compatible vector database implementing HNSW indexing and binary quantization. Drop-in pgvector replacement optimized for memory efficiency and query performance at scale

projects.name: Zenith
projects.description: Python web framework with chainable query APIs, zero-config setup, and async request handling. Built for developer experience and production performance

projects.name: sy
projects.description: File synchronization tool with delta sync, parallel transfers, and streaming algorithms. Modern alternative to rsync built in Rust

projects.name: Kombrucha
projects.description: Package manager with parallel downloads, dependency resolution, and improved caching. Homebrew alternative focused on speed and reliability

projects.name: Pacabot
projects.description: Trading bot with market analysis, automated strategy execution, and risk management. Real-time data processing for algorithmic trading

awards.title: 2nd Place & Ingenico Winner
awards.summary: Team Kairos - Developed cross-terminal payment application with REST API for business partnerships. Built with Go and PostgreSQL, deployed on CoreOS
